{{Relevant tutorial|Speedrun}}

A '''speedrun''' in {{MC}} is a play-through of the game performed with the intention of achieving a set goal as fast as possible. Speedruns may cover the whole game or a selected part, such as completing all [[achievement]]s, or killing a certain boss, usually the [[ender dragon]].<ref>{{Mcnet|how-speedrun-minecraft|How to speedrun Minecraft|July 20, 2019|[[Ash Parrish]]}}</ref>

== In the ''Minecraft'' franchise ==
=== Maps ===
On the [[Marketplace]], several maps have been released either centered around or feature a speedrunning mode.

=== Allusions ===
In [[Java Edition 23w13a or b]], the mob [[Ray Tracing (mob)|Ray Tracing]] has a chance to mention "practicing speedrun stats." The release also contains the feature "Dream Mode," likely referencing the YouTuber {{Wikipedia|Dream (YouTuber)|Dream}}, who is known for allegations of cheating speedrunning records.<ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.polygon.com/2020/12/15/22176341/minecraft-youtube-dream-speedrun-cheating-mod-world-record-piglin/|title=YouTubeâ€™s big Minecraft cheating scandal, explained|author=[https://www.polygon.com/author/patricia-hernandez/ Patricia Hernandez]|website=Polygon|date=December 15, 2020}}</ref>

Speedrunning is referenced within the novel [[Minecraft: The Tournament]], where several of the characters express an interest in it. Early in the story, protagonist [[Jett Warner]] is introduced playing one. It is also briefly mentioned in [[Minecraft: The Haven Trials]].{{More info}}
